action.action-desc: Mr. Grothman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend part E of title IV of the Social Security Act to enable a State to be reimbursed for child welfare training expenditures made by a nonprofit educational institution in the State.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Child Welfare Workforce Partnership Act.

section.header: Child welfare training expenditures made by nonprofit educational institution deemed to be made by State for purposes of Federal reimbursement

subsection.text: Section 474 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 674) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Child welfare training expenditures made by nonprofit educational institution deemed To be made by State
subsection.text: For purposes of this section, an expenditure described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of subsection (a)(3) which is made by a public or private nonprofit educational institution and which would be an allowable expenditure if made by the State claiming reimbursement with respect to the expenditure, shall be considered to have been made by the State, except to the extent that Federal funds have been paid with respect to the expenditure.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to claims submitted on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
